discussion.content: A and C. alter can be used to set password.

questions.question_text: Which two methods allow a DBA to reset a user's password? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The backup operation will finish only when backup-and-apply-log is executed.
choices.C: The --backup-dir option holds temporary output, status, and metadata files.
choices.D: The backup operation will finish only when apply-log is executed.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Back up to image is Single file operation

choices.A: kill -15 should be avoided. Use other methods such as mysqladmin shutdown or systemctl stop mysqld.
choices.B: kill -15 and kill -9 are effectively the same forced shutdown that risk committed transactions not written to disk.
choices.D: mysqld_safe prohibits commands that would harm the operation of the server. An error would be returned by the kill command.
choices.C: kill -15 carries out a normal shutdown process, such as mysqladmin shutdown.

questions.question_text:
Consider this shell output and executed commands:
[root@oel7 ~]# ps aux | grep mysqld
mysql 2076 3.5 24.6 1386852 372572 ? Ssl 12:01 0:01 /usr/sbin/mysqid
[root@oel7 ~]# kill -15 2076
Which statement is true about MySQL server shutdown?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is Ckill -15 carries out a normal shutdown process, such as mysqladmin shutdown.
 It sends a SIGTERM signal to the MySQL server to perform a graceful shutdown. 
This means that the server will complete any ongoing transactions, flush caches, and close connections before shutting down.

questions.question_text:
MySQL programs look for option files in standard locations.
Which method will show the option files and the order in which they are read?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
mysqladmin --debug is disable in MySQL 8 

Any long option that may be given on the command line when running a MySQL program can be given in an option file as well. To get the list of available options for a program, run it with the --help option. (For mysqld, use --verbose and --help.)

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about raw binary backups? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: D is wrong, binary is not human readable. BE

Selected Answer: BE
As raw binary logs are not easily human readable

choices.C: They are required to obtain FIPS security compliance.
choices.B: The data format is identical to how MySQL stores the data on disk.
choices.D: The resulting files are easily human readable.
choices.A: They are converted to a highly compressible binary format.
choices.E: They are faster than logical backups because the process is a simple file or file system copy.
